title: Bug 49299 - Servlet 3.0 ch.7.1.1 incorrect behavior with custom cookie name and URL rewriting
description: In chapter 7.1.1 of the servlet30finalspec.pdf, it is mentioned that if a web application configures a custom name for its session tracking cookies, the same custom name will also be used as the name of the URI parameter if the session id is encoded in the URL (assuming URL rewriting is enabled). However, the actual behavior does not match the expected behavior.
OB:
The page sends the following cookie:
SetCookie: MYSESSIONCOOKIE=658C60E714E9C7C833F4FDA366E0477F; Path=/cookiename; HttpOnly
But the Reload link on the page uses "jsessionid":
http://localhost:8080/cookiename/index.jsp;jsessionid=658C60E714E9C7C833F4FDA366E0477F4.
EB: I would have expected the Reload link to be: http://localhost:8080/cookiename/index.jsp;MYSESSIONCOOKIE=658C60E714E9C7C833F4FDA366E0477F
SR:
1. Deploy the attached 'cookiename.war' file.
2. Open the web application in a web browser.
3. Navigate to a page that encodes the session id in the URL.
4. Observe that the session tracking cookie is correctly set with the name 'MYSESSIONCOOKIE'.
5. Click on the Reload link.
6. Verify that the URL contains the session tracking parameter with the name 'MYSESSIONCOOKIE' instead of 'jsessionid'.
